DataElement.preferredName: Lower Plasma Very Long Chain Fatty Acid Therapeutic Procedure Administered Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the therapy administered to lower plasma very long chain fatty acids.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lower Plasma Very Long Chain Fatty Acid Therapeutic Procedure Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: To become lower, grow less, or diminish, as in amount, intensity, degree, or value._Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation._A class of dietary fatty acids that have an alkyl chain length above 21 carbon atoms._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Lower Plasma Very Long Chain Fatty Acid Therapeutic Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: To become lower, grow less, or diminish, as in amount, intensity, degree, or value.:Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.:A class of dietary fatty acids that have an alkyl chain length above 21 carbon atoms.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: To become lower, grow less, or diminish, as in amount, intensity, degree, or value.

Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
A class of dietary fatty acids that have an alkyl chain length above 21 carbon atoms.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly._Text; the words of something written.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
